sentences.en: A boisterous festivity or celebration; merrymaking. Often used in the plural.
sentences.cn: 喧闹的饮宴或庆典; 作乐. 常用作复数.

sentences.en: A watch over the body of a deceased person before burial , sometimes accompanied by festivity.
sentences.cn: 死人的尸体在埋葬或火化前存放的地方.

sentences.en: Chinese New Year is the longest and most important festivity in the Lunar Calendar.
sentences.cn: 农历新年是世界上最长的和最重要的节日在农历新年.

sentences.en: It is also celebrated in China, but only alloted a single day for festivity.
sentences.cn: 在中国这个节日也是要庆祝的, 但只有一天.

sentences.en: It quickly became apparent that the herring, potatoes, and were consumed at just about every festivity.
sentences.cn: 不久就很容易可以发现几乎每个节庆都会食用鲱鱼 、 马铃薯 、 和香甜酒.

sentences.en: Legends about the origin of this festivity abound.
sentences.cn: 关于腊八节起源的传说有很多.

sentences.en: Masks worn on holidays such as Halloween and Mardi Gras signal festivity and license.
sentences.cn: 节日里戴的面具,比如万圣节或者四旬斋前的最后一天所戴的面具是一种庆祝和许可的表示.

sentences.en: Night is the time of ease and festivity, of revels and gaiety.
sentences.cn: “夜晚”是轻松和宴会的时候, 也是狂欢和作乐的时光.

sentences.en: Overnight , we had given him a farewell dinner , in which sadness was well mingled with festivity.
sentences.cn: 他这一去可能就是多年, 席上有些人恐怕今世也难得再见他面.

sentences.en: She is always finger in the pie if her neighbours are planning any little festivity.
sentences.cn: 要是她的左邻右舍准备办任何小的喜庆事,她总是巴不得参与其事.

sentences.en: Suddenly he felt lonely and far removed from all this festivity.
sentences.cn: 他突然感到寂寞.这一切似乎都跟他隔得远远的.

sentences.en: The festivities started with a procession through the town.
sentences.cn: 庆祝活动以全城巡游开场。

sentences.en: The festivity will be held tomorrow.
The royal wedding was an occasion of great festivity.
sentences.cn: 皇室婚礼是喜庆的盛事.

sentences.en: The wedding was an occasion of great festivity.
There was a general air of festivity and abandon.
sentences.cn: 到处是一派纵情狂欢的气氛。

words.tran_cn: 节日；庆祝，纪念活动；欢乐

trans.tran_en: things such as drinking, eating, or dancing that are done to celebrate a special occasion
